availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Reuben B. Munday (Major in the 6th Kentucky Cavalry.)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Madison County native. Married to Nancy Taylor Munday in Madison County on October 31, 1832. Father of William H. H. Munday. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Major and lieutenant colonel in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 11, 1861, to March 24, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 136-37.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 89.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183302, p. 188-89.
Find A Grave, "Col Reuben Munday (October 3, 1809-April 10, 1880)," Memorial #18958872, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18958872 (accessed October 31, 2018).
